result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon M Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to sentence being served in Michigan.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact direct or indirect with Evenson Laundry, EE.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Jonathon M Dixon in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Defendant Jonathon M Dixon in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Court reviews letters sent by Defendant. Defendant makes statement. Court imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.
Sentencing hearing at 03-01-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Jonathon M Dixon in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Defendant Jonathon M Dixon in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will enter plea today, requests that sentencing be put off for a few days. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
